dt: {bc}to bend the head, body, or knee in reverence, submission, or shame
{bc}to incline the head or body in {d_link|salutation|salutation} or {d_link|assent|assent:2} or to acknowledge applause
{bc}to incline especially in respect or submission

dt.t: whose heavy hand hath {wi}bowed{/wi} you to the grave {it}Shakespeare{/it}

dt: {bc}to express by bending the head, body, or knee {bc}to express by bowing
{bc}to usher in or out with a bow {dx_def}see {dxt|bow:2||}{/dx_def}

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}būgan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}biogan{/it} to bend, Sanskrit {it}bhujati{/it} he bends
shortdef: to cease from competition or resistance : submit, yield; also : to suffer defeat
to bend the head, body, or knee in reverence, submission, or shame
to incline the head or body in salutation or assent or to acknowledge applause

dt: {bc}a bending of the head or body in respect, submission, assent, or salutation

shortdef: a bending of the head or body in respect, submission, assent, or salutation; also : a show of respect or submission

dt: {bc}something bent into a simple curve or arc
{bc}a weapon that is used to propel an arrow and that is made of a strip of flexible material (such as wood) with a cord connecting the two ends and holding the strip bent
{bc}a metal ring or loop forming a handle (as of a key)
{bc}a knot formed by doubling a ribbon or string into two or more loops
{bc}a frame for the lenses of eyeglasses
{bc}the sidepiece of the frame passing over the ear
{bc}a wooden rod with horsehairs stretched from end to end used in playing an instrument of the {d_link|viol|viol} or violin family

et: Middle English {it}bowe{/it}, from Old English {it}boga{/it}; akin to Old English {it}būgan{/it}
shortdef: something bent into a simple curve or arc
a weapon that is used to propel an arrow and that is made of a strip of flexible material (such as wood) with a cord connecting the two ends and holding the strip bent

dt: {bc}to play a stringed instrument with a bow {dx_def}see {dxt|bow:3||5a}{/dx_def}
{bc}to cause to bend into a curve

dt: {bc}to play (a stringed instrument) with a bow

shortdef: to play a stringed instrument with a bow
to cause to bend into a curve

et: Middle English {it}bowe, bowgh{/it}, probably from Middle Dutch {it}boech{/it} bow, shoulder; akin to Old English {it}bōg{/it} bough
shortdef: the forward part of a ship —often used in plural
